alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Wind Advisory issued April 16 at 1:58PM PDT until April 18 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR LAKE TAHOE... ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MONDAY TO 8 AM PDT TUESDAY FOR LAKE TAHOE... * CHANGES...New Lake Wind Advisory for Monday and Tuesday. * WHAT...For the Lake Wind Advisory today, southwest winds 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. Waves 1 to 3 feet. For the Lake Wind Advisory Monday and Tuesday, southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. Waves 2 to 4 feet. * WHERE...Lake Tahoe. * WHEN...For the first Lake Wind Advisory, until 8 PM PDT this evening. For the second Lake Wind Advisory, from 1 PM Monday to 8 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Small boats, kayaks and paddle boards will be prone to capsizing and should remain off lake waters until conditions improve. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Breezy west winds will continue through Wednesday.
info.instruction: Check lake conditions before heading out and be prepared for a sudden increase in winds and wave heights. Consider postponing boating activities on the lake until a day with less wind.
